Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally located next to Mall of Emirates. Shopping, Food is definitely not a problem... Good value compared to other hotel in Dubai. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Room is compact but nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “great staff rooms poor”
Reviews.Author: rodCork
Reviews.Content: The room was very very basic. the staff were very good, bar food very good. if the rooms were up graded would stay again as had no other complaints. hotel within walking distance of the shopping mall. taxis available at all times right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 days stay at the IBIS Mall of Emirates”
Reviews.Author: NareshShanbhag
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 nights stay at the IBIS. Conveniently located near the Mall of Emirates. Clean budget hotel. Limited food & drinks facilities at the hotel. But with the Mall nearby, one has ample options there. A little far away from the airport. Courteous staff. Overall good experience staying at the IBIS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, good services,in a good location. Hotel is good for singles or couples on a short stay becasue the rooms are small. I liked their 15 minutes service. Internet is provided free of charge in the lobby area only and with a fee in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Amelia S
Reviews.Content: This was just a short stay but the staff were fantastic. They let us store our luggage and ensured that we knew exactly where we were going for the day. The answered every single question we had which was a fair few. The one bedroom has a small bathroom but is fine for a stay of 2 nights or even 3 or 4 as you don't need to spend all that much time in there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights with my husband on vacation. The staff is great and the location is perfect. There is always a taxi cab out front. The mall is a block away and has plenty to see and eat. Weather was perfect in Feb, 75F and sunny. The front desk can assist with booking activities in Dubai. PROS: Free internet in lobby is great. Bar and room service is recommended. Staff is friendly and helpful. CONS: Pool is next door and is not free. Internet in room is pricey if you are staying for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: WaleedMadanat
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers all that you'd expect from the AccorHotels Group. The room was modern, clean and nice. I didn't mind it being small. The food was very good and I enjoyed the free WIFI in the lobby. The staff were very helpful. What I also liked was it's location, adjacent to the Mall of the Emirates.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Lacertilia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 nights and hotel served the purpose. Clean and basic. Breakfast was ok, enough to fill you up. For a 2 star hotel its good. Front desk was a little difficult to communicate with at times but helpful. Mall of emirates is a 5 minute walk. There were water bottle dispensers in the room floor.Everywhere is a max 20-30 mins (10-15 euro). Desert safari is nice to do. Burj Khalifa is impressive. Dubai is nice for a couple of days. If back again would stay at Ibis for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aclampkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights prior to taking a Royal Caribbean cruise on Jan 16, 2012. The place is a very clean, no frills hotel. It was two blocks from the Mall of Emirates. What I really liked about this place was the free wi-finin the lobby, but wished it was available free of charge in the rooms. I also loved the fact that they have a 24hr restaurant. The meals were reasonably priced around $15 or so for an entree and $8 for desserts. A can of soda was about $4. Save your money and go to the hybermart inside the mall and purchase a six pack for about $3.00. The market is just like a superwalmart. They have everything in there. The lobby area is very trendy and they also have 2 computers you can use. Taxi are so cheap, no spot is a bad place to be. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No non-smoking room availble”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ------------------------- Good location, but found out only at checkin that there were no non-smoking rooms available. Beyond that the hotel is ok, simple, but as expected. -------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: rohss
Reviews.Content: It was not at all a good experience staying at Ibis Mall of the Emirates, Dubai. Hotel location is good. Mall of the Emirates is on the other side of road and is about 5 mins walk. Front desk staff (Ms. Yogita) was very nice n helpful but the hotel itself is not up to the mark. To start with hotel room is too small with no mini bar. There is just a hand wash liquid in bathroom on the name of bathroom amenities which has to be used both for bathing n washing hands. Size of the bathroom itself is too small. No tissue was provided in bathroom. Very limited choice of channels on TV and most of the available channels are in Arabic. While checking in it was told that common PC (2 nos) in lobby can be used for free for accessing the internet but the next day, it was told to us to buy internet pack. Price of the room service was exorbitantly high, may be more than a 5 star hotel. One bottle of water, which is AED1.5 in market they are charging AED 15 and it took 30 mins to get the water in room. There is neither any bathrobe, nor any sleepers or tea coffee making facility in the room. All in all it seems more like a hotel with 2 star facilities at the price of 4 star. Room tariff is way on the higher side comparing to the provided facilities. There are many hotels and hotel apartments in the vicinity of this hotel which are much cheaper and provide more facilities and amenities than this property. Better to give it a pass and to choose other hotels around Mall of the Emirates.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value..”
Reviews.Author: dxb09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4nights in Nov-09 and Oct-10 . Its very good value at approx €60 per night and the location is quite good - 2mins walk from Mall of the Emirates. Room size is decent but bathroom was small. However, they were clean and modern and definitely fit for its purpose. Breakfast at 55 DHS was good value - all you can eat. Didn't eat dinner there or use the bar. Internet available in room (wired access) or at lobby which is wireless. Prepaid vouchers available from reception starting from 25DHS for 1hr. No safes in room but secure safes available at reception. Plenty of taxis always available outside of the hotel to explore Dubai! If you want to see Dubai and only want somewhere to throw your head down at night, without breaking the bank, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convienient”
Reviews.Author: FiGooOOoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers exactly what they say they do. its very neat, clean and economic. you will save a lot of money. its a very short walking distance from emirates mall where you can ride the metro. the hotel is elegant and representable to meet your guests at. the restaurant offers very good food, and very good value for money. you need the room card to ride the elevator, which for some might be bothering. but staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and clean. It is situated right next to the Mall of the emirates. Just walk over the road and you're there. All of the Taxis we used knew where to find the htel so there is no problem getting around. Breakfast a little prey but apart from that , no problems

Reviews.Title: “Wlking distance to all your needs at your private time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dubai is a hectic business environment, I prefer to keep away from taransportation or trafic after business hours. This hotel convenient to access MOE or other restaurants etc. Hotel is not charming by itself but good for short stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The quality of service and what is expected to see in the room is at the reasonable price. The room is just perfect for the quality and is enough for budget traveler. The location is right behind Mall of the Emirates which I spend most of my time there. The only drawback that I didn't like is the shower. They should have at least a door for the shower area otherwise when finish showering all the floor is wet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, the hotel is basically Ibis standard in regards to the room and to the facilities. Location is very good as it is close to Mall Of The Emirates Shopping Mall and around 800 meter to the Metro Station. What surprised me is the standard of the breakfast. I under estimated it. I was really happy about the standard of the breakfast. Excellent choice for budget travelers and quick overnight stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: SerGioDubai
Reviews.Content: I've been in this property several times after living in Dubai for 4 years. The location is NOT on the beach, but fantastic. Walking distance from the huge Mall of Emirates shopping mall and from the city light train, very close to Dubai MArina also. Rooms are brand new, clean and functional, in typical Ibis style. food is good too. taxis always available day and night. Not girl-friendly policy. Very good sleeping quality. Excellent service. Trying the chinese health center TCM next block is imperative: best massage or agupunture in town for very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations, but get your visa somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: stellarsupreme
Reviews.Content: Considering that Dubai being a very expensive city I thought that given the price for the Ibis we would get a bad hotel, but the Ibis did not disappoint. The decor is very modern, the rooms are decent in size with basic amenities in line with the price you pay. The location is good, next to the Mall of the Emirates where there's a metro station. The Burj Al Arab is a 10 minute ride from the hotel and the Burj Al Khalifa is 20 min by car or 30 min by metro. The cons of the hotel: the visa service is VERY BAD, even we sent our documents with more than 2 months in advance, they sent our visas on the very same day of our departure, and the story doesn't end there: given you are required to secure a guarantee deposit for your stay in the UAE, we were given our refund more than 1 month after our UAE departure. Would I go back? Yes, but I would get my visa somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stop over”
Reviews.Author: ab299
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Mall of the Emirates based on location. We checked in very quickly and were provided a map of the area. The room was larger than other Ibis hotels we have stayed at and everything was very neat and clean, it it a modern new hotel without frills; no safe, mini bar, etc. We ordered room service, it arrived on time but was served in plastic take away containers with plastic cutlery, the food was fine but it did make the food hard to eat, I would suggest they swap to real crockery and cutlery. The hotel is across the road from the Mall of the Emirates so we were able to go there for a couple of hours before it closed at midnight, the next day we went to the Dubai Mall, which is much bigger. All staff were very friendly, especially the Front Office Supervisor upon Check out. I would recommend to stay here if you are stopping over in Dubai and want to be close to the Malls.

Reviews.Title: “My first time at IBIS”
Reviews.Author: SOUHOB
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for price” perfect location open 6 hours for good breakfast free parking staff were friendly and helpful .also the Metro station, which gives easy access to anywhere in Dubai.The hotel lobby and reception area is very modern and comfortable.There are other hotels in the same street but at higher prices

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near MOE”
Reviews.Author: Besanc0n
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in early March 2011. Our aim was to stay as near to Mall of emirates as possible and this is the most decent and affordable hotel that showed up in search. There are other hotels in the same street but at higher prices. -I got a deal without breakfast as we were so close to MOE that we went there for bf daily and started our day. -The lobby was well designed and decorated. - Rooms are very basic and very small. too small for the luggage. no minibar, no fridge. bathroom amenities are Ok and you can ask reception to drop by more soap/shampoo etc. - you can have your room done by housekeeping on request also if you had a lazy day. - Taxis are available at the hotel doorstep, who run the meter so chance of con. - Best part is that being near to MOE, it is also near to MOE Metro station. - Internet is paid in rooms and wired. Wifi internet is free in lobby only. there is also 1 PC The great thing was that everyday after a lond day of shopping and roaming around ,we used to watch the midnight or 12:30am movie in MOE and could easily walk home. So if you want to stay close to MOE and Metro, at an affordable price in a small room then this hotel is for you as it is 7 mins walk to the kempinski entrace of MOE. i.e the one near to the cinemas.

Reviews.Title: “Near by a mall, Metro, but you will need a cab”
Reviews.Author: jonatasmelo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, best Ibis I stayed, with very good prices. It is walking distance from Mall of Emirates, one of the largest malls in Dubai, but it is far from everything else. You will need a cab, or a car for everything. In the other hand, Dubai Taxis are relatively not expensive, so it is still a good place for a short visit to know Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLouise5
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and reception area is very modern and comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and check in and check out was quick. The room was very spacious and comfortable although the bed was very hard! You can easily walk to the mall which is great for a choice of food outlets. It is easy to get a taxi outside and the hotel is very convenient for visiting The Palm and the Burj. We used the hotel pick up service from the airport which was fantastic. We visited the restaurant and bar during our stay, both of which were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fair stay. Bad luck with the room”
Reviews.Author: sioFont
Reviews.Content: 3 out of 5 it's my rating, but not everything bad to be credited to the hotel, but to bad luck. In other circumstances, it could be a 4 out of 5. Bad luck means: connecting door to a room with very noisy people. As others have said, it's a very clean hotel, if very basic. Too basic even for a Ibis. But it's worth the price. Maybe a bargain in a expensive city. Close to the Mall of the Emirates (5 minutes walk), which has a metro station and a lot of shops and eateries. But in the hotel's street there are a couple of grocery stores and some turkish restaurants. Room is small, but I think it's not tiny. (I was travelling solo.) Air conditioning works well. Bathroom is, as in others Ibis, basic: a small shower and a washbasin. TV has a fair selection of channels. Windows don't open. There is a paying wired internet access in the room, but the lobby is a free wi-fi hotspot (ask the front desk for the free password). Staff is helpful and polite, but not extremely attentive. Correct in all cases. I took the buffet breakfast, and was generous in the line of a 2 or 3-star hotel. Staff was slow cleaning the tables and preparing them for the next customer. My bad luck: there is a mosque near the hotel, that calls muslims around 5am. And my room had a connecting door to a room with several people that started praying loudly after the mosque call. So, while the room was more or less quiet (some traffic because it was in front of elevators), this 'middle-of-the-night' religious thing broke my rest. Maybe walls isolate sound well, but it's not the case of doors. After visiting other Ibis around the world, this one looks too basic: no paper nor pencil to take notes; no bathroom extras as a solid soap, a little hand towel or a shower cap; towels looked very, very reused (I didn't expect a fluffy, egyptian cotton towel, but not either an overlaundered one.) Fixes: renew the towels, add some extras to the room (at least paper and pencil) and expedite cleaning during breakfast. In any case, I recommend this hotel, not just because it's cheap but because it have a good level in its category. (As a reference, a taxi to the airport at night (with supplement) is around 80 dirhams; during the day, around 50.)

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean hotel.. Nothing luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Annie2112
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. The rooms are very clean and neat however the toilet is really small. There is no space to move around. That would be my only complaint. If you are looking for luxury this is not the place. It's a very basic room. Overall, the service was good, the buffet breakfast had a decent spread and I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “My personal favourite hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for people who have work around the surrounding areas. It is very close to Mall of Emirates and the train station. The disadvantage was the worn out towels which I recommend that it should be checked and replaced on regular bases to maintain a good quality.

Reviews.Title: “good as travelling on budget to dubai”
Reviews.Author: Omani_madridi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is average, rooms are just alright... u get what you pay but unfortunately there is no fridge and the shampoo in the toilet is very bad and there was a bad smell coming out of the AC's!!!. on the bright side, the staff are friendly, there are plenty of TV channels to watch and best of all, it is just few steps from mall of the emirates and there are many restaurants near by including subway

Reviews.Title: “Notes”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is good but I leave the hotel because no refrigerator in room and no wireless internet and you have to tell the customer this in beginning. I have medicine need refrigerator and this is problem to me

Reviews.Title: “very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: minhue
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel last year in november for a week by web site. It's was a very good deal: location is very convenient near by the famous mall of emirates and from 5 MINUTES walk to the metro station. So you can reach very fastly the airport, the beach and all others main shopping area without traffic jam. Lobby is nicely designed, with nice pizzeria and breakfast room (very complete breakfast for low price). Rooms are new and comfortable (don't forget this is three stars standard) typically ibis new standards. Service is very nice and helpful. You can have nice coffeebreak just nearby at the terrace of the SUITEHOTEL (just open the separate door between the two hotels); taxi is available if needed outside for raisonnable prices. If compared with most of other hotels , you can never find a smarter one so well located and nice. And if you want bigger room fully furnished with 4 stars standard level, try the Suitehotel , we will book there the next time going to Dubai (Ibis room is little narrow for a stay one week long without wardrobe)

Reviews.Title: “Delighful for a quick budget stay”
Reviews.Author: ZTA87
Reviews.Content: The best hotel for a budget stay in Dubai. The location is perfect next to the Mall of the Emirates in Al Barsha, has free underground parking accessible with the room keycard, great interior design, restaurants and bar with acceptable food, barber; NO SPA OR POOL OR FITNESS CENTER. Also, since it is a budget hotel, there aren't any fancy toiletries as in other hotels; showers have a 2in1 shower gel/shampoo, and sinks have the hand wash, so bring your own toothpaste. *TIP: book at least 2 days in advance of the weekend for an even cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would definitely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: england12320
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location. The hotel is located close to the mall of the emirates (5 min walk) and thus very close to the metro. From the airport you can get a metro straight to the hotel for 5dirhams which is much more efficient and cheaper than a taxi. The breakfast was also great and a good range of food (hot buffet also). I was only expecting a continental breakfast since we only paid £46 for the room per night however the breakfast range and quality was fantastic. The area was really nice (opposite from the Burj Al Arab) and also close to the public beach. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here if you want a cheap but nice hotel in a good part of town. We also arrived at 8am in the morning and the hotel staff were great and had our room ready. There are also lots of taxis outside this hotel so it is not difficult to flag down taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for clean, large rooms and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TLTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, the rooms were clean and large enough to our liking. Bathrooms were nicely done. In-room Internet was quite expensive. Short walk to the Mall of Emirates for all your shopping needs, food court with cuisine galore and if a midnight ski run is your night habit, then this mall has it as well. Foley large with modern motif. The cafe was a great place to chill and use the Internet. Did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but it served all meals of the day. Lobby computers for paid use. . Hotel staff was really helpful in making our stay wonderful, from checking in, checking out and all the tourist questions in between. Taxi cab rides need to all the other locations if you don't have a car Likes: The staff, the staff, the staff was amazing Easy walk to Mall of Emirates Could of done better: Expensive in-room Internet cost, so you have to bring your laptop down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RioLimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights , very clean good food, great value about 30€ a night , some value for dubai. Bedrooms a bit small, very little space for hanging clothes, but for short term its ok. Very close to Mall of the Emirates, very easy to get taxies. Staff very friendly and helpful, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: chelrisla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on an early bird deal and got a really good price. I wasn't expecting much as it is only a 2 star hotel but I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby area is modern and spacious, with free wifi. The rooms are modern, good sized bathroom. The hotel staff were always helpful. I have rated 4 for location as it is a stroll to mall of the emirates and metro station, but also there doesn't seem to be a 'city centre' in Dubai. You can also use the pool at the sister hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPohl
Reviews.Content: A typical Ibis hotel, this one however in a great location , 200 m from the Mall of the Emirates (ski drome etc), right on Sheikh Zayed road, the train station is nearby too. The in-room internet connection is prohibitively expensive BUT you have free WiFi at the ground floor area (lobby, restaurants, bar).. The front desk staff are just great , in fact the entire team there is always there to assist. Only negative issue to me is that the bathroom towels are rather small and thin and occasionally you get a frayed towel that should be taken out of circulation. There is a bistro right opposite the hotel which also has free WiFi. As there is no fridge in the room, or a minibar, you can buy all your sundries at a local sundry shop just 50 m opposite the hotel. If you drive, use the hotel car park ..parking outside is now metered.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Ibis Hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: PEET7G Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I must say It was the very first Ibis Hotel that actually impressed me. The Hotel is new, so the rooms are new too and pretty big for an Ibis Hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpfull making all requests effortless so 5 stars to them! The Hotel has easy acces to the Dubai Metro (better walk through the Mall, you will die walking on the sun) and practicly in the backdoor of the Mall, so very convinient for shopping or city visit, however far out from the city center. I was impressed by the choices at breakfast (for an Ibis Hotel) and that they served warm meal. Not just intercontinental but Arabic too. So all summed up, this was the very first Ibis Hotel that actually impressed me, so this makes this Hotel a Very good choice if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Samir_now
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 7 nights. Breakfast is good. Room a bit small. Staff is extremely helpful. Have to pay 30 dirhams for pool though. I would come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Really good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adysri
Reviews.Content: IBIS is a really good hotel for the rates that they charge. It has all the basic necessities with a tint of Luxury as well. The room and the bathroom are little small but again has all the basic stuffs including a study table and sufficient cupboard space. They are very hygiene conscious to the extent that even without asking to make the room they use to clean it everyday without fail for all the 6days that we have stayed. A very good option for a couple.The only minus point was that the breakfast buffet spread is same all the days and very monotonous. Not enough choice for the veggies. Location-wise again it is really good as it is located 2mins walking from the Mall of Emirates from where one can take metro to any part of Dubai and there are a lot of activities inside the mall as well. So all in all a good option & will definitely stay there again in our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: peter216
Reviews.Content: While it's a good hotel, the breakfast was very average with very poor coffee and not much of a choice !.. Also the hotels transport to the beach charges 20 drm which I thought excessive as the other ibis in diera didn't charge for it's beach transport

Reviews.Title: “Compliments to Yao Yao at the Front Reception Desk at/and the Ibis Mall of Emirates”
Reviews.Author: chelseasurn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Mall of Emirates just recently. The hotel was modern and simple, and a great location for the price. And the hotel staff was very kind and personalized, I specifically need to mention Yao Yao who assisted us when we checked-in. He is professional, curteous and welcomed us so warmly on our arrival, he even remembered our surnames and addressed us by it a few days later when he saw us again, and also asked are we enjoying our stay. We found that quite impressive, and just gave that extra personal touch. As for the hotel itself, the room we had was very standard, aircon, tv, phone etc, but it didnt have a bar fridge which we missed, but there were ice buckets available down the corridor which we made very good use of. It takes about 5minutes to walk to the Mall of Emirates, and from there you can also access the Metro, or walk straight to the Metro from the hotel, which takes less than 10minutes. There were also always taxis waiting outside the hotel, so that too was great. We had standard breakfast included, and that had a range from cereal to scrambled eggs to different cheeses and coffees etc, well worth it. We would definately stay there again, and recommend it to anyone wanting to pay a good price and be close to a mall or metro line when in Dubai. Thanks for a great stay, and huge compliments to Yao Yao, which made it even more impressive!!! I've also sent this review and these compliments through to Rajesh Eckbur (Night Manager).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis at the Mall of Emirates is located in the perfect spot. You can walk to the mall, and it is not too far from the airport. As a business traveler I appreciate the location though I can have a good nights rest and run over the mall to do some shopping. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful... I have only good things to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Expereince”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at the ibis Mall Of The Emirates between 24/05/2011 and 26/05/2011with my family was one of my worst nightmares! I never ever saw such crocks managing a hotel in my life. 1. My nightmare started when the front desk told me the Internet service at my room is chargeable unlike the Hotel's Web Page!? Calling the Manager on duty made it ever worse! It looks he never hear of something called 'Customer Satisfaction'! He told me it is available at the lobby. It was extremely difficult for me to run downstairs with my laptop and lots of confidential papers to do my work. 2. Then, we were surprise when we found no refrigerator ant any of the 3 rooms we have occupied! We told: "This is a hotel standard"!? Room refrigerator is one of essential piece of furniture, especially in hot countries when people require refreshments more than they need them on cold weather areas. 3. There were no paper tissue boxes in rooms! When I called talked to the manager on duty, she told me: 'This is a hotel standard'!? Usually, this is not only a service to customers; it is rather a service to the hotels around the World in order to prevent occupants from spitting on their carpets or use beds' sheets to clean their noses! So, it is for the benefit of the hotel more that it is for the occupants. I have been in different hotels around the World, including those in poorest countries in the Globe, I never ever so badly treated like the way I have treated at your damned hotel. I have told all my colleagues about my very bad experience at your hotel, while each member of my family did the same with his/her colleagues. I STRONGLY WORN PEOPLE TO USE YOU HOTEL ESPECIALLY WITH BAD MANAGEMENT AND TIRRIBLE POLICY YOU ARE CURRENTLY HAVE. Sa'ad

Reviews.Title: “Basic room - but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce043
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights as a stop-over to Europe. The initial impression is great - the lobby and restaurant areas are top-class, shiny and new. However when you get to the room, it is pretty ordinary. It is painted a faded yellowy colour and is quite small. There were also some basic comforts which I would like to see - minibar, tea/coffee making, iron (which you can get from reception), information booklet about Dubai. However the room and bathroom were clean, service was OK, we slept peacefully, and the location is pretty good (walking distance to the large mall, but about 20 mins by cab to Dubai Mall/tallest building, Jumeirah Beach etc). We both thought the hotel buffet breakfast was excellent, it had everything you need. We didn't get the chance to eat at the restaurant. This was the cheapest hotel we had on our trip and was one of the best, so I would have to rate it as very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai stopover”
Reviews.Author: HackoSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing fancy. The rooms did not have tea and coffee making facilities. I cant pinpoint what is missing from this hotel but it is quite an impersonal hotel to stay in. The staff were always obliging but there is no homely feel. The breakfast was very average and the evening meal menu did not excite us. We spent most of our time at the Mall across the road which has to be seen to be believed!! Plenty of restaurants and a snow ski slope!!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hotel - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheaper stay, then Ibis is okay. Hotel functions well, but choose to stay here if you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel. Bar space disappointing, not good value. Go elsewhere. Rooms have no tea/coffee, fridge - I wasn't expecting this.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: CatSkunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night when we transferred to Male. The hotel is 45 minutes away from the airport by metro, and 7 minutes away from the metro station by foot. The hotel is very close to the Mall of Emirate and Carrefour. It is also convenient for visiting Jumeirah Beach, Palm Island and Burj Al-Arab. But it is a little far from Dubai Mall and old town. The room is clean, but not very big. The staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diptangshu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. Staff were pretty helpful. very near to Metro station and Mall of the Emirates. Free 24 hours high speed internet connect in Lobby. Really good place to stay...... The thing upset me is there was no complementary drinking water for the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: ManamaClaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The rooms are compact but not claustrophobic. the decor is new and modern. Staff were pretty helpful and interested in receiving feedback. It's within walking distance from the Mall of the Emirates - otherwise it's taxis to pretty much everywhere. No frills but then that's why the price is low. they've managed to make it feel a higher quality establishment than the price suggests. Loads better than its counterpart at the World Trade Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: DavelynBuderim Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used the stopover on our Emirates flight enroute to Paris and found the welcome and service offered as good as one can expect considering our early morning arrival. Our welcome was even more successful as we arranged to pay an extra nights accommodation to ensure that we had a room immediately on arrival. The services provided by the hotel were in our opinion better than average and the linkage with the adjacent Novotel added value if one needed to venture to other options. The location beside the Mall of the Emirates at a short walk away gave more than adequate access to Dubai transport services.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for Family”
Reviews.Author: srini0402
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located to the very good shopping mall in Duabi. Just 5 Min walk from hotel will put you in skydubai! Excellent place for kinds to play around. The hotel was very clean and pleasent. more than that the price offered is very reasonable for the facilities offered in the Al Bharsa area in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Experience and Overpriced Food”
Reviews.Author: MNLakhani Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis MOE is not very different from any other Ibis hotel. Standard 3 start service and facilities but located beside Mall of Emirates. The Buffet Breakfast was a complete Rip off with no variety of dishes and substandard food quality. Will only stay there again if I have to visit the nearby Media or Internet City early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel That Serves Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: chandler8528
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Hotel is located in Al Barsha, right next to the Mall of the Emirates. The first thing that strikes you about the hotel is the smell of smoke anywhere you go. Even though you have non-smoking rooms, there is strong smell of smoke throughout the hotel. While the staff at the front desk are passable, the room service at the hotel is pretty good. The rooms by itself are adequate for the price. There is no mini bar in any of the rooms. For internet connectivity, all the rooms have only paid wired connections, no wireless facility. The hotel however provides free wi fi at the lobby for all guests. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was a tad disappointing. There is however a café right opposite the hotel that has some wonderful options. The location is ideal if you want to do shopping (Mall of the Emirates), go to the beach (Jumeirah, Dubai Marina) or your work is in Al Qous Industrial area or Jebel Ali. Travel to and from the hotel is very convenient with cabs readily available in the vicinity. There also is a Metro Station at the Mall of the Emirates. The Ibis is a budget hotel that doesn’t provide you anything more than it promises and in that aspect, it serves its purpose. If you are not looking for too much except a bed to crash in during your stay, this is a highly cost effective option.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good hotel . no internet in room but only in the lobby . clean and near emirates mall . near metro . friendly stuff . good value for money even it is 2 star hotel . it is perfect for business and vacation .

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jasonmac3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and clean with very friendly staff. The rooms are compact but are exactly what you want: clean & modern. I will stay here again, great location and fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: redanteater
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Hotel Mall of the Emirates is a great value - the price is quite reasonable (under US $100) per night. Rooms are small and sparse (only amenities in the bathroom are liquid soap on the sink and shower); there's not much in the room other than the bed, a desk, television, and phone. As the hotel is relatively new, it is clean, and it's not bad for a few nights stay. The hotel is about a block from the Mall of the Emirates (no problem walking in February, but I wonder what it's like in the summer). Internet access and breakfast are extra, but if you splurge for the breakfast, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: tropic51
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this property today. Its quite a bit more upmarket than the average Ibis property. Rooms are compact but certainly big enough for two people, and the location is good if you want to be close to Mall of the Emirates, Emirates Golf Club and Palm Jumeirah. The internet is expensive if you use it in your room, but free WiFi is available in the lobby 24/7 and is fast and reliable. Breakfast is fairly expensive at Dhs55 per person, but the food is of a good quality and there's a fair selection of items. The hotel doesnt have a pool but for Dhs30 you can use the pool at the Novotel next door. Its a small pool but very clean and the sunbeds are very comfortable. As for getting around, the Dubai Metro is close by, but in spite of the hotel's location, Sharaf DG station is closer and easier to walk to from the hotel than Mall of the Emirates station. Staff at the hotel are polite and friendly, and all requests were dealt with immediately. I would certainly stay here again if I needed accommodation in the area and didnt want to spend a fortune. Its good value for money, clean, comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite spending little tie in the hotel due to business meetings, the location, rooms, cleanliness, and basic facilities are all perfect, as in most cases with Ibis and other Accor Hotels locations

Reviews.Title: “Super!!!”
Reviews.Author: stes1952
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The standard room is big enough for 2 persons and very clean. The location is perfect, only two minutes walking to the Mall of Emirates and nearby the metro. You have only to cross a very dangerous traffic road!! I will recommend this hotel to everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay (Dec. 2010)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be very friendly. I also enjoyed the location of the hotel which is quite close to the Mall of the Emirates. However, the room was quite small and the toiletries were quite disappointing. Also, there was no kettle or refridgerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Mafidor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was no frills as expected from Ibis accommodation in the 'value for money' price range. The staff were friendly and helpful and there was a wide range of breakfast items to cater for all tastes. The location was within walking distance from the Mall of Emirates, the train station and the Big Bus Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect from a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: ads102
Reviews.Content: I can only be positive about our stay here. If you book in advance you can get amazingly low rates. We booked 3 months before our stay. The hotel looks pretty new, the rooms were very clean and modern, fully aircon (which you need in dubai!). The reception staff were efficient and friendly. We ate in the italian restaurant in the lobby and the food was nice and well priced, although the place was mostly empty which was a little offputting. There is a SuiteHotel attached (they are both Accor hotels) so you can walk through and eat there, you can also use their pool for a fee. It's a 5 minute walk to the Mall of the Emirates, which is a little awkward to get into (designed for people in cars not on foot) and there was some construction work that spilled out onto the pavement, meaning you had to walk on the road a bit. None of this was the hotels fault though. The metro station is accessable through the mall of the emirates and this makes getting around Dubai much easier than it was a couple of years ago, and cheaper than taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not exactly at Mall of the Emirates”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on the whole very good. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is not accurate to describe it as at the Mall of the Emirates as it is 5 minutes'walk away. In December this is fine but in the summer this could be a hot and sweaty experience! I expected the hotel to be actually part of the mall but it isn't. The room was tidy but could have been slightly better vacuumed. The bar there is very expensive at over 7 pounds sterling for a pint of lager but apart from that the hotel offers good value.

Reviews.Title: “very bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: You can find better hotels in the are with less price, wider space and better service quality. Mostly you have to request from the room services to clean the room . You'll be amazed the time the room is not clean when coming back at night asking them again to clean the room but the answer is "they are only works from 9-5"

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel close to Mall of Emirates”
Reviews.Author: fema
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty basic. Its major plus is the proximity to Mall of Emirates. For the rate we booked it, we expected more comfort and amenities. The room was very small, hardly can fit two guests and the luggage. The wardrobe was very small, without closing door and clothes were exposed to sunshine for part of the day. Some basic toiletries were missing. The shower in the bathroom is without door/curtain. No supply of water, no tea/coffee making kettle, no minibar/fridge. At least hairdrier was available. For the three days of our stay, the housekeeping staff did not find appropriate time to clean our room and to clean garbage bin! They came once when we were in the room, and when we were out they did not manage to come and clean it.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was in a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Me23l
Reviews.Content: This hotel really surpassed my expectations. I've stayed at ibis around the world several times, and this has been my favourite one. Everything is great, from the ambience to the location to the room, but especially the customer service. The friendliest, most helpful staff. No problem is too much trouble. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want good service and friendly smiles. Thank you ibis mall of emirates!

Reviews.Title: “PArty and shopping time in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: elftalker
Reviews.Content: The Ibis hotel is very cheap, and with good confort. Just next to the mall of the Emirates. The proximity to the mall of the emirates is a real must. The room are small but confortable. With a minimalist concept. You have everything you need, Internet connextion, TV, small but practical bathroom with shower. The services are based on the groundfloor and are also kept minimum: with a bar, a cafe and small restaurant. It is once again not fancy, but it is IBIS: cheap, clean, confortable, and practical.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Next to MOE”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Singh
Reviews.Content: It's five minute walk away from the Mall of Emirates (MOE). Hotel is clean, well maintain and excellent value for money and has all the regular Ibis feature except a tea kettle and water in the room. Although you can buy juices and water from the vending machine. The bar is a good place to chill out in the evening, but generally crowded and will have to wait 5-10 min for your drink to arrive. The great plus is multi-lingual well trained workforce. If you are trying to use metro frequently, then it's not advisable as the walk is nearly 15 minute to reach the nearest (MOE) metro station. It also has a multi-cuisine restaurant at the ground floor, which we did not try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but wet feet and other drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: mikeskor49
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location within walking distance of Mall of the Emirates and Ski Dubai. It's also a reasonably -priced taxi ride away from Wild Wadi Water Park with its excellent fun and view of the iconic Burj Al Arab Hotel. The Ibis is also reasonably priced, clean and interestingly decorated. Staff were average friendly. However, on the negative side, there was no safe in the room which always makes me feel insecure because one has to hide valuables, carry them or entrust them to the hotel safe. Also there was an unpleasant charge for the internet and it was rather difficult to access especially if you don't have a laptop and use the hotel machine. The bed was hard. And use of the shower could flood the entire bathroom because the shower cubicle was only half covered, water did not drain away fast enough and there was only a small rise in the floor to separate shower from bathroom. To overcome this problem, I had to take off the drain cover so water could drain faster. In any case, the spray nozzle beside the toilet leaked anyway, flooded the floor and caused me wet feet whenever I visited the loo. Nevertheless, price and location still are enough to make me recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: visitiran
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, god location, good staff...... the only wrong matter was room service

Reviews.Title: “Amazed at the quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: darkes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the best location, and if you're planning a trip where you'd like to spend a lot of time relaxing in the hotel, this may not be for you. But seeing as how you have to cab it everywhere in dubai anyway, the location is not much of deterrent. It is still on the main 'strip'. The hotel is spotless, modern, and an excellent value. Breakfast buffet was pretty good as well. It's also just a short walk to the sky train at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: PuelmaTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel, the rooms are very clean and the staff is very helpful. Emma from the reception was great with us! It is cheap, the restaurants are great, breakfast is varied and the location is very interesting since you are a couple of minutes walking from Mall of teh Emirates and in the middle of Dubai! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills hotel with rude customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tulipsnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in Feb and was warmly greeted by reception. Enquired abt the internet charges for 1 hr & 12 hr packages. Asked for clarification from the friendly receptionist if we purchased the 12hr internet package, is it a consecutive connection (one-time login) or can we use it over the period of stay by logging in/out? We were told that we could log in and out as long as the total usage was within 12 hours, over several days. When we got into the room, we signed up for the internet 12 hour package online. We logged in once, and logged out after 1 hour. Little did we know that we would not get to use the internet again becos even thou we had logged out, it was a consecutive connection. One day later, we tried to login to the internet and realised we couldn't. Called the front desk and was rudely told that internet packages differ when purchased from the reception, and when you select to activate the internet from your room. Apparently, internet packages purchased from reception will allow you to login and out over several days as long as the total usage is not exceeded. Whereas the internet package from the room online is consecutive. We informed the Manager who was now referred to calm us down that this was not stated anywhere (not even in the T&C in the login page, or at the front desk, and the receptionist certainly did not inform us of such a difference). The Manager was adamant that this was our own fault. We then asked for a copy of the T&C as it was stated on the online login that a copy could be obtained from the hotel. The Manager then told us that he does not have a copy of the T&C. The Manager then offered us a 1 hr complimentary internet coupon because we were already on the phone for 15mins with this dispute and it felt like he just wanted to get us to shut up. This was extremely upsetting as we had to pay for the 12 hr package thinking it would allow us to use it over several days. And further damage was done when the manager simply told us that it was our own fault. We were on the phone trying to dispute that this was no where clearly stated for 15 mins. The manager then sent up a lady staff to our room to pass us the 1 hour complimentary voucher. I opened the door and the lady staff simply glared at me and rudely shoved the voucher into my hands when I opened the door. We were so upset by the whole incident that we didn't use the 1hr complimentary voucher and we were still forced to pay for the 12 hr package upon checkout. We gave them back the 1hr complimentary voucher by the front desk just shrugged their shoulders and told us it doesn't matter to them whether we used it or not. Other than the upsetting incident with the internet and management, the room is clean but no-frills. There is no safe in the room, no fridge, no bar. Forget about hoping for any toiletries (no toothbrush, no bars of soap) as there was none. There is a liquid soap dispenser attached to the wall, and a shampoo dispenser in the shower, also attached to the wall. The hotel is within 10 mins walking distance to the Mall of the Emirates which is pretty good. Overall, the ibis brand name is good as the hotel was well-maintained and clean. The service staff needs to go through customer service training again, including the Manager. We have travelled around the world and have not been treated so curtly and rudely. Would have expected better behaviour from a staff of the management. And the incident spoilt our whole trip. I would not stay at this hotel again unless the staff improves their attitude and I would not recommend others to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep well for its value for money”
Reviews.Author: oscar28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more like an up-market student hostel rather than a hotel, I spent 5 days and found it reasonable for the price as it is in quite a good and quiet location. The hotel is in a high rise block walking distance from the mall of the Emirates (the one with the ski slope). The beauty of its location is that it is also close to the metro/subway station on the brand new Dubai metro line so you can go to other places without fighting the infamous traffic jams of Dubai. The hotel staff are helpful and efficient at check-in and check-out but don't expect much more, it is only listed as a two start hotel. The common areas have nice modern decor and furnishing in a reasonable condition given that it is less than one year old. The rooms are average size suitable for one person and a couple would find it cramp, especially the small bath room. Each room has usual shelf, bench table and a non-opening window which blocks the noise from main streets where busy traffic can be seen or heard. The bathroom is small but without any accessories and fittings for but the shower works well. No tea making facility in the room and also NO free broadband internet so go to Starbucks at the mall if you are desperate for either. Breakfast was OK in the ground floor restaurant but I only eat once there. The hotel is a bargain for business men who needs a room at last minute because prices are standard and it seems static compared to other hotels which raise prices for late bookings or event bookings. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and I will come back for winter stays. Those who want to use the IBIS in summer should remember that there is no fridge or minibar in room so no cold drinks in room

Reviews.Title: “A little bit more than Ibis' standard”
Reviews.Author: kinothai
Reviews.Content: Located right next door to the Mall of the Emirates, this Ibis offers the chain standards you can find almost all arond the world, but the staff, expecially at the front desk makes the difference. Kind, polite and helpful. The room is really as per standard. Very clean. Good breakfast buffet and restaurant open 24 hours. Really appreciated. Easy access to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai-ibis”
Reviews.Author: JulianB1
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, only smoking-rooms available, very close to the Mall of the Emirates (the indoor ski-hall is in there) but unfortunately always the need for a taxi (as everywhere in Dubai) to get to the various sights.
